dareQuestions.question: Text your mom asking if she knows where to buy a hazmat suit without explaining why.
Do 10 pushups right now while maintaining eye contact with someone in the room.
Recite the alphabet backwards in under 20 seconds.
Post a childhood photo of yourself on social media with a dramatic backstory that's completely made up.
Speak in an accent of the group's choosing for the next 10 minutes.
Call a friend and tell them you've spotted their celebrity crush in your neighborhood.
Turn off all the lights and tell a scary story using only a flashlight on your face.
Do your best dance move right now for at least 30 seconds.
Create a 30-second commercial for a ridiculous product the group invents.
Put as many marshmallows (or grapes) in your mouth as possible and try to whistle.
Text the 7th contact in your phone and ask them for cooking advice on a dish that doesn't exist.
Stand outside and howl at the moon for 30 seconds (day or night).
Go into another room alone and scream, then come back acting like nothing happened.
Do a handstand against the wall or try for at least 15 seconds.
Solve a math problem created by the group while standing on one foot.
Wear your clothes backwards for the next 15 minutes.
Call a restaurant and ask if they serve a completely ridiculous dish with a straight face.
Let someone else post a status update on your social media account.
Listen to the most intense part of a horror movie soundtrack with your eyes closed for 1 minute.
Do your best impression of a fitness instructor for 1 minute while everyone follows along.
List 10 countries and their capitals in 30 seconds.
Talk to a household object like it's your long-lost best friend for 1 minute.
Show everyone your most embarrassing photo on your phone.
Let someone go through your browser history for 30 seconds.
Watch the trailer of the scariest movie you've never seen and give a live reaction.
Try to juggle three items of the group's choosing for 30 seconds.
Make up a haiku about the person to your right on the spot.
Attempt to do a cartwheel or somersault right now.
Send a voice message to a friend singing 'Happy Birthday' regardless of whether it's their birthday.
Close your eyes and let someone feed you something from the fridge.
Write a short, creepy message and leave it somewhere for someone to find later.
Hold a plank position while answering trivia questions for 1 minute.
Describe a movie plot in reverse, and have others guess the title.
Do your best impression of a famous celebrity taking a selfie.
Send a text to a friend asking for urgent advice about a fictional pet llama problem.
Let someone draw something on your face with washable marker.
Hide somewhere in the room and jump out to scare the next person who walks by.
Spin around 10 times and then try to walk in a straight line.
Tell a story where each person adds one sentence, but your sentences must all rhyme.
Put on a pair of sunglasses and dramatically narrate everyone's actions for 2 minutes.
Let the group look through your music playlists and play the most embarrassing song they find.
Text your crush or an ex something the group decides (keep it appropriate).
Stand in front of a mirror in dim lighting and tell a ghost story about the room you're in.
Try to touch your tongue to your nose while hopping on one foot.
Translate a nursery rhyme into sophisticated academic language on the spot.
Using only kitchen utensils, create and perform a 30-second musical number.
Let everyone scroll through your camera roll for 30 seconds.
Put an ice cube down your shirt and leave it there until it melts completely.
Blindfolded, touch various objects the group chooses and try to guess what they are.
Do your best impression of an Olympic gymnast sticking a landing.
Name 15 animals starting with the letter S in 30 seconds.
Make up a rap about someone in the room on the spot.
Call a parent and tell them you're thinking about getting a tattoo of their face.
Trade an article of clothing with the person opposite you until your next turn.
Lie on the floor and have someone cover you with a sheet like a ghost for 1 minute.
Balance a book on your head while walking across the room and back.
Make up a fairy tale featuring at least three people in the room.
Let the group mix a drink of non-alcoholic items from the kitchen, and you have to drink it.
Post 'I'm finally ready to share my big news...' on social media and don't post again for 4 hours.
Let someone choose your profile picture for a social media account for the next 24 hours.
Record yourself telling a scary story and send it to someone not in the room with no explanation.
Do the worm (or attempt to) on the floor right now.
Create a 30-second stand-up comedy routine about the room you're in.
Draw a self-portrait with your non-dominant hand while looking at yourself in the camera.
Text the last person you spoke to on the phone and ask them to marry you.
Go outside and try to convince a neighbor to join your made-up cult dedicated to office supplies.
With lights off, tell everyone about your deepest, most irrational fear.
Perform a TikTok dance the group chooses, even if you don't know it.
Solve a riddle the group finds online within 90 seconds.
Create a superhero persona based on your most embarrassing habit.
Send a voice message to a friend speaking in song lyrics only.
Eat a spoonful of the spiciest condiment available in the house.
Let the group pick a scary makeup look and wear it for the rest of the game.
Demonstrate three yoga poses you've never tried before.
Take a 'What animal are you?' quiz online and act like that animal for 5 minutes.
Stuff your cheeks with snacks and try to whistle a recognizable tune.
Start a conversation with the person next to you pretending they're your long-lost royal relative.
Do a trust fall with someone in the room.
Let the group tie your hands together for the next 10 minutes.
Show us your best moves for escaping a zombie horde.
Debate with yourself on a controversial topic, taking both sides convincingly.
Try to make a serious announcement while the person next to you tickles you.
Let everyone in the room choose one word, then incorporate all words into a dramatic monologue.
Take a cold shower for 10 seconds (fully clothed is okay).
Let someone blindfold you and lead you around the house for 2 minutes.
Limbo under a broomstick held by two people.
Create a conspiracy theory connecting three random objects in the room.
Attempt to moonwalk from one side of the room to the other.
Send the 11th person in your contacts list a selfie with a random filter.
Let someone write a word on your forehead in washable marker.
Allow someone to describe a horror movie scene, and you must act it out dramatically.
Do your best breakdance move on the floor.
Take a random object and deliver a 1-minute sales pitch for it like you're on Shark Tank.
Pretend to be possessed by the spirit of a famous celebrity for 2 minutes.
Post a status asking for recommendations for a completely ridiculous activity.
Lie on your back and let someone drop water from a spoon into your mouth from a height.
Go into a dark bathroom, turn around three times, and say 'Bloody Mary' while looking in the mirror.
Try to do the splits, or get as close as you safely can.
Create a poem using only words that start with the same letter the group chooses.
Give a 1-minute lecture on a topic you know nothing about with complete confidence.
Show the last three people you texted and what the messages were about.
Go outside and ask a stranger to take a selfie with you.
Let someone describe their recurring nightmare and act it out.
Hold a squat position while answering personal questions for 1 minute.
Play a memory game: someone lists 10 items, and you have to recall them all in order.
Make up a song about the person to your left and perform it enthusiastically.
Call a local business and ask if they deliver something they obviously don't.
Let someone else post your next story on Instagram.
Let the group create a spooky new hairstyle for you that you must wear for the next hour.
Race someone across the room while crawling backwards.
Try to draw the United States map from memory in 60 seconds.
Put on a blindfold and try to apply lipstick or chapstick perfectly.
Start speaking in the third person about yourself for the next 15 minutes.
Give your phone to someone else and let them send a text to anyone they choose.
Create an alibi for a fictional murder that happened in this room 5 minutes ago.
Do a crab walk across the entire room.
Try to list 20 four-letter words in 30 seconds.
Try to tell a joke while someone tickles you.
Send a mysterious emoji sequence to a friend with no explanation.
Let the group choose a temporary tattoo location and design for you.
Let someone whisper the creepiest thing they can think of into your ear.
Hold a wall sit for as long as possible while singing your favorite song.
Estimate how many jelly beans would fit in the room you're in and explain your math.
Do a dramatic recreation of your most embarrassing moment.
Let the group create a new dating profile bio for you that you have to use for a week.
Go to the kitchen and take a small bite of the spiciest thing you can find.
Let someone draw what they think your greatest fear looks like on paper.
Do as many jumping jacks as you can in 30 seconds.
Create a fictional backstory for a random object in the room as if it were evidence in a crime.
Speak in rhymes for the next 5 minutes.
Call your most recent ex or crush and ask them for their favorite recipe.
Run around the outside of your house or building once.
Let everyone in the room write one word on a piece of paper, then create a horror story using all the words.
Do the chicken dance for 1 minute with total commitment.
Try to name a country for every letter of the alphabet in 2 minutes.
Let someone else style your hair however they want.
Send the last photo you took to your family group chat without context.
Swap clothes with the person opposite you for the next round.
Let the group come up with a terrifying creature, then you must act like you've just seen it outside the window.
Hold a plank position while reciting the pledge of allegiance or national anthem.
Create an alternate universe where one everyday object doesn't exist and explain how society adapted.
Try to make a sandwich using your feet only.
For the next 10 minutes, start every sentence with the last letter of the previous speaker's sentence.
Allow someone to put an ice cube down your back.
Act out a scene where you're the sole survivor in a zombie apocalypse.
Take off your socks using only your feet.
Make up three fake 'facts' about yourself that sound believable but aren't true.
Show your best dance moves to a song the group chooses.
Let everyone check the last three photos saved to your camera roll.
Let someone feed you three mystery food items while blindfolded.
Tell the group about a recurring nightmare you've had.
Demonstrate how you would escape if your hands were tied behind your back.
List all 50 US states in alphabetical order (or as many as you can in 2 minutes).
Let the group put makeup on you while you're blindfolded.
Go outside and sing 'Happy Birthday' loudly to someone who isn't there.
Let the group choose an embarrassing profile picture for your social media for 24 hours.
Stay in a dark closet or bathroom alone for 3 minutes.
Try to do the macarena while standing on one foot.
Create an alternate ending to your favorite movie on the spot.
Try to lick your elbow for 30 seconds.
Text your most recent match on a dating app (if applicable) with a cheesy pickup line the group chooses.
Let someone else send an email from your account (nothing harmful).
Let the group come up with a scary story and you have to act out the main character's reaction.
Race someone while walking backward across the room.
Count backward from 100 by 7s as quickly as you can without making a mistake.
Try to burp the alphabet as far as you can get.
Call someone in your contacts and speak only in movie quotes for the entire conversation.
Let everyone in the group add one ingredient to a drink that you have to consume.
Let someone tie your hands together and try to escape within 2 minutes.
Do 20 sit-ups while answering personal questions.
Pick two random objects in the room and convince everyone why they should be used together as a new invention.
Pretend you're an auctioneer and auction off random items in the room for 1 minute.
Let the group come up with a new nickname for you that everyone must use for the rest of the game.
Ask a neighbor for a strange ingredient you don't need.
Let someone cover you with a sheet and pretend to be a ghost haunting the room.
Do your best imitation of an Olympic figure skater's routine.
Describe the most complex movie plot you know in under 30 seconds.
Let everyone in the room add one article of clothing to your outfit that you must wear for the next hour.
Create and perform a jingle for the person to your right.
Let someone spray you with cold water unexpectedly in the next 10 minutes.
Tell an improvised two-minute ghost story that takes place in this building.
Do 10 burpees right now.
Create a backstory for why everyone in the room is stranded on a desert island together.
Try to wrap yourself completely in toilet paper in 60 seconds.
Let everyone go through your social media and pick a post to like from 3+ years ago.
Let someone pour a small amount of cold water down your neck.
Turn off all the lights and tell a story about why this house/building is haunted.
Attempt to juggle three items the group chooses for 30 seconds.
Make up a short story using only song titles you know.
Put on as many layers of clothing as possible in 60 seconds.
Call a family member and tell them you've decided to join the circus.
Go outside and yell your deepest darkest secret (that you're comfortable sharing).
Put on a horror movie for 2 minutes and react dramatically to everything.
Do 20 jumping jacks while singing your favorite song.
Say the 50 states (or as many as you can) in alphabetical order in under 2 minutes.
Speak in a made-up language for the next 3 minutes, and try to get someone to understand you.
Post a status asking for recommendations for your upcoming fictional wedding to a celebrity.
Let the group choose something for you to wear on your head for the next 30 minutes.
Let someone draw a fake scar on your face with makeup.
Try to do a cartwheel or somersault (if it's safe to do so).
Make up a conspiracy theory explaining why we never see babies and dogs in the same room.
Let someone put makeup on you using their non-dominant hand.
Pretend to be best friends with someone in the room you don't know well for the next 10 minutes.
Let someone pluck one of your eyebrow hairs.
Sit alone in a dark bathroom with just a flashlight for 3 minutes.
Do your best impression of a runway model walking down a catwalk.
Write a short poem about someone in the room in 60 seconds.
Try to make a mustache out of something you can find in the room.
Create a secret handshake with a stranger in the room and perform it.
Let someone choose a temporary tattoo to put on you in a visible location.
Listen to a one-minute clip of a horror movie soundtrack with your eyes closed.
Do a duck walk across the entire room.
Tell a story where each sentence must start with the next letter of the alphabet.
Let someone give you a makeover using only items found in the kitchen.
Send a text to your crush or a friend saying 'We need to talk' and ignore their response for 10 minutes.
Take a bite of a raw onion or garlic clove.
Let the group create a creepy doll using items in the room that must stay next to you.
Attempt to do 5 push-ups with someone sitting on your back (if safe).
List 10 different uses for a paperclip that aren't its intended purpose.
Act out a dramatic soap opera scene with someone else involving a shocking betrayal.
Swap phones with the person next to you for 5 minutes.
Put an ice cube in your mouth and let it melt completely.
Create a creepy sound effect and let everyone close their eyes while you perform it from different parts of the room.
Hold a yoga pose of the group's choosing for 1 minute.
Rank everyone in the room from most to least likely to survive a zombie apocalypse and explain why.
Let everyone watch as you show your oldest selfie on your phone.
Text your mom asking what she thinks about you getting a face tattoo.
Let someone write something on your arm with a marker.
Have someone secretly write a creepy note and hide it in your pocket to find later.
Try to touch your nose with your tongue while doing squats.
Name 5 countries and their capitals in 30 seconds.
Try to imitate 3 different animal sounds and have people guess them.
Let the group decide on an embarrassing auto-correct mistake you have to 'accidentally' send to someone.
Run around the house/building outside barefoot (weather permitting).
Close your eyes while each person in the room touches your face with something creepy (but safe).
Walk across the room with a book balanced on your head without dropping it.
Take any object in the room and pitch it like it's a revolutionary new product on Shark Tank.
Ask Siri/Google/Alexa an embarrassing question in front of everyone.
Let the group reply to one of your text conversations.
Let someone drop something unexpected down the back of your shirt.
Lie on the floor and let everyone surround you and stare at you for 1 minute.
Arm wrestle with the strongest-looking person in the room.
Come up with a 30-second advertisement for the most boring object in the room.
Go outside and try to have a conversation with a plant or tree for 30 seconds.
Let the group choose a ridiculous hashtag for you to use on all social media posts for the next 24 hours.
Let someone throw 5 ice cubes down your shirt.
Let someone blindfold you and feed you something without telling you what it is.
Demonstrate how you would sneak into your own house if you lost your keys.
Make up and perform a commercial jingle for your least favorite household chore.
Let someone style your hair with only kitchen utensils.
Call a store and ask if they have an obviously fictional product in stock.
Stand outside and howl at the moon (or sky) for 30 seconds.
Let someone put a blindfold on you and lead you around the house for 2 minutes.
Attempt to do a handstand against a wall (if safe).
Create a two-minute speech about why unicorns should be the national animal.
Let the group mix together a drink using at least 4 condiments that you must take a sip of.
Text your crush or a friend asking them to rate your personality on a scale of 1-10.
Go outside and sing the national anthem at the top of your lungs.
Lie on the floor and let people put light objects on you while you pretend to be a corpse.
Try to lick your elbow while hopping on one foot.
Make up a new ending to your favorite movie that completely changes the message.
Do your best impression of a YouTube makeup tutorial using imaginary makeup.
Let someone else choose your profile picture for social media for the next 48 hours.
Take a cold shower for 15 seconds (fully clothed is fine).
Tell the group what you think would be the worst way to die.
Do your best impression of a basketball/soccer/football player scoring the winning point.
Create a believable conspiracy theory about something mundane in the room.
Swap clothes with the person to your right for one round.
Create and perform a TikTok dance on the spot.
Let the group hide one of your possessions somewhere in the house/building that you'll have to find later.
Go to the bathroom mirror, turn off the lights, and say 'Bloody Mary' three times.
Try to do a split (as far as you can safely go).
Create three fake headlines that would completely change the world if they were true.
Put five pieces of ice in your pants and keep them there until they melt.
Send a nonsensical but urgent-sounding voice message to someone not in the room.
Let someone else look through your browser history for 1 minute.
Share your most irrational fear and let the group act it out.
Show everyone your best dance move and have them rate it.
Come up with a believable lie about yourself and see if the group can spot it.
Try to draw a perfect circle freehand while the group judges it.
Let the group look through your search history and pick one thing to ask you about.
Let someone spank you with a spatula or wooden spoon.
Go into the bathroom alone and tell a scary story to your reflection.
Do 15 squats while balancing a book on your head.
Try to solve a basic math problem while someone tries to distract you.
Let someone pour a small amount of cold water over your head.
Show everyone your camera roll and let them choose a photo to post on your social media.
Walk up to a window and scream as loud as you can.
Let everyone write one scary word, then create a horror story using all the words.
Do a crab walk from one side of the room to the other while balancing something on your stomach.
Translate a nursery rhyme into sophisticated academic language.
Pretend to be a news anchor reporting on the ridiculous activities happening in the room.
Show the most embarrassing app on your phone and the last time you used it.
Eat a spoonful of hot sauce or spicy condiment.
Let the group create a horror movie scenario starring you that you must act out.
Demonstrate how you would escape if you were tied to a chair.
Try to explain a complex topic (like quantum physics) in simple terms a 5-year-old could understand.
Let someone use your face as a canvas for a one-minute drawing with washable marker.
Act out meeting your favorite celebrity and having them be extremely disappointed in you.
Let someone pour a small amount of a condiment of their choice on your hand that you have to lick off.
Stand in front of a mirror in dim lighting and tell a story about your own ghost.
Try to do a handstand or wall stand for at least 10 seconds.
Create a short poem where every word starts with the same letter.
Smell everyone's feet and rank them from best to worst.
Let someone go through your text messages for 30 seconds.
Let the group choose a song for you to perform dramatically in public (or out a window).
Choose one person who must whisper something disturbing in your ear that makes you visibly uncomfortable.
Do a leap frog over someone (if safe and they consent).
Create a 30-second commercial for the most useless product you can think of.
Let someone feed you a spoonful of something while blindfolded.
Choose someone in the room and give them a dramatic makeover with whatever's available.
Hold an ice cube in your hand until it completely melts.
Find the creepiest photo on your phone and explain the backstory.
Do a barrel roll across the room (if there's space and it's safe).
Recite the Pledge of Allegiance or national anthem backwards.
Let the group choose three random items for you to use in a one-minute stand-up comedy routine.
Text your partner/crush/friend asking their opinion on you getting a face tattoo.
Let someone choose a contact on your phone for you to prank call.
Create a 30-second horror movie trailer starring people in the room.
Do your best martial arts moves while making appropriate sound effects.
Improvise a one-minute speech about why aliens definitely exist.
Let the group choose a filter and take an embarrassing selfie that you must keep as your profile picture for 24 hours.
Tell everyone your most embarrassing childhood nickname and the story behind it.
Eat a tablespoon of the hottest sauce available.
Let everyone in the room write a creepy sentence that you have to incorporate into a story.
Try to do the worm dance move across the floor.
Without using your phone, try to draw a map of your country from memory with major cities labeled.
Attempt to apply lipstick or lip balm without using your hands.
Let the group choose your dating app bio that you must use for the next week.
Eat a raw garlic clove or small piece of onion.
Let someone write a spooky message on your back with their finger and guess what it says.
Try to jump and touch the ceiling (or get as close as possible).
Try to list all of Santa's reindeer in 20 seconds.
Put an ice cube in your underwear and let it melt completely.
Let everyone vote on a new hairstyle you have to wear for the rest of the game.
Blindfolded, let someone feed you something unexpected from the fridge.
Let everyone leave the room, turn off the lights, and stay alone for 3 minutes.
Do your best impression of a ballet dancer for 30 seconds.
Make up an alternate history where dinosaurs never went extinct and explain how society would be different.
Put your socks on your hands and try to make a sandwich.
Let the group compose a text message to send to your mom or best friend.
Let someone pour cold water on your feet.
Describe in detail what you think is the scariest supernatural creature and why.
Do 15 lunges across the room while balancing a book on your head.
Try to name one movie that starts with each letter of the alphabet in 3 minutes.
Use only your feet to unwrap and eat a candy or small snack.
Let the group choose an embarrassing story about you to share on social media.
Let someone blindfold you and put three mystery items in your mouth to identify.
Share the most disturbing dream you've ever had in detail.
Hold a plank position for as long as possible (minimum 30 seconds).
Spell your full name backwards without hesitating.
Create and demonstrate three new dance moves named after people in the room.
Let someone choose a random person in your contacts to send a selfie to without explanation.
Play chicken with someone - stare into their eyes without blinking or laughing until someone gives up.
Let someone write a fake crime scene outline around your body with tape or string.
Perform 10 push-ups of any variety (modified is fine too).
Create a convincing fake fact about each person in the room.
Attempt to sing a song while someone presses on your cheeks.
Let the group choose one question to ask your most recent Tinder/dating app match.
Let someone pour a small amount of a drink down your back.
